intro: Palicourea lopeziana, commonly known as Lopez's palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly found in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
